posts.description: In this image, dawn breaks over California while riding the Coastal Starlight from Portland to San Francisco. In 2015 I rode a train across the United States with 39 other young creatives. If you find yourself on an Amtrak in the next month, pick up a copy of The National from the seat-back pocket and check out my photo essay. üöÉ‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®

Are you on an Amtrak train? Will you be on an Amtrak train soon? Check the seat-back pocket for the April/May issue of The National, and you'll find a photo essay about my cross-country train trip! üôåüöÉ‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®

posts.description: Quick! Head to @thephotosociety account and check out my IG Story from Scotland üôÜ I was given the opportunity to share a few fun facts and take our audience on a mini expedition. The image above is from a hike on the Quiraing, a Mordor-esque section of the Isle of Skye üèù

Hiking to the French Glacier is a somber experience. Patagonia is the "poster child" for climate change, where massive glaciers are melting at a rate the locals can barely comprehend. Last March, during an unseasonably warm day, we hiked up to the wall of the French Glacier with a park ranger to see how quickly the behemoth was melting. The ranger hikes here every day, a pathway not open to the public, and pointed out that the pond on the left side of the frame is about where the Glacier was two weeks prior. In only 14 days it had retreated nearly 60 feet. // To see more from my travels in Patagonia, pick up the April/May issue of @natgeotravel
posts.localization: Torres del Paine National Park, Patagonia, Chile

posts.description: These baqueanos (Chilean cowboys) take care of all the horses on the property of Las Torres Patagonia. They spend their days touring around Torres del Paine and making traditional sopaipilla (a fried pastry) and yerba mate served in a gourd. If you zoom in on the man on the left you can see he has a knife in his belt loop with a handle crafted from the claw of an emu. Check out more from my travels in Patagonia by picking up the April/May issue of @natgeotravel !

Torres del Paine has every natural feature you love turned up a notch. Sharper mountains, bluer lakes, and wilder life. Read more about it in my story out now in the April/May issue of @natgeotravel !
posts.localization: Torres del Paine National Park, Patagonia, Chile
